instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Have a 820-3115 that has green light but wont power on. No liquid damage.

PPBUS_G3H 12.60V
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_INSIS 5V
PP5V_S5 5V
PP5V_SUS 0V and not shorted to ground.

what to check next? Replaced u7940 but no change

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Post SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_SLP_SUS_L.
Are you using original 60/85W charger?
Check all 4 RTC signals if OK.
Also check 32KHz presence at U2600.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V

PM_BATLOW_L 0.18V

PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V

Using bench power supply with original 85W plug. Board using 0.15Amps

RTC_RESET_L 0V

PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.3V

PCH_INTRUDER_L 0v

PCH_INTVRMEN_L 3.3V

Do not have a oscilloscope for checking u2600

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
You have few important missing signals.
Check R1801 and R/C1803 first.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
changed SMC with different results

r1801 PCH_INTRUDER_L  3.3V  PPVRTC_G3H 3.3V

R1803 RTC_RESET_L 3.3V

C1803 RTC_RESET_L 3.3V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
"SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V

PM_BATLOW_L 0.18V

PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V"

Post these again now...

"Also check 32KHz presence at U2600.
-------------
Do not have a oscilloscope..."
Post DC voltage at least...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V

PM_BATLOW_L 0.18V

PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V

pin 12 SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC u2600 0.401V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Did you pick the SMC from the same model donor board?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: I suspect something is pulling the signal low. Either the SMC or PCH seems most likely to me.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Post PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, 3V3_S5, S5_PWRGD.
Also check again all 4 RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.2V

PM_DSW_PWRGD 0V

3V3_S5 3.3V

S5_PWRGD 0V


RTC_RESET_L 3.3V

PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.3V

PCH_INTRUDER_L 3.055v

PCH_INTVRMEN_L 3.3V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
"S5_PWRGD 0V"
Bad and also will affect PM_DSW_PWRGD.
Post voltages for U7941.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: u7941 pin2 3.4V  pin 3 3.4V pin 4 0v pin 6 3.3V pin 7 0v pin 8 0V

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Check C7941 and/or corrosion at pin 7.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: solved after replacing c7941 and u7941
